intro: Argyrolobium kilimandscharicum, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro silverlobed crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features distinctive silver-gray leaves with a hairy texture, and its flowers are typically yellow with a distinctive black or purple pattern. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, often found in the mountainous regions of Kenya, Tanzania, and Uganda.
